text: Chestnut color. Malty boozy sweet aroma and flavor. A little one note - fruitybooze - but pleasant.
My brother: pours amber with beige head. Aroma is whisky, wood, sugar, maple syrup. Taste is sweet and barrels. Large maltiness. Super smooth for the high abv. Really nice.

Bouteille. Bière dun cuivrée très foncé surmontée dune fine mousse beige qui disparaît rapidement. Au nez, elle offre des arômes de bourbon, de caramel, de raisins secs, dalcool, de gâteau à la vanille et une touche hebacée. En bouche, le bourbon est encore bien présent, tout comme le caramel et les raisins secs, des notes boisées viennent sajouter et lalcool est proéminent et vient réchauffer la gorge en finale. Le corps nest pas trop dense et leffervescence est prononcée.
Light brown. Cardboard. Sweet. A lot of bourbon. Oak. Hints of cherry. Too strong for me. Thx youri!  Not my thing

Merci à Mademoiselle Irina pour le partage. Liquide dapparence sirupeuse mi cuivré mi brun, très mousseux et collant au verre. Joli look. Au nez je note une quantité importante de réglisse rouge, de raisins secs, de bourbon et de bonbons au butterscotch de marque Wethers. Ça promet dêtre sucré ça mes amis! Tel quattendu, beaucoup de sucre. Du raisin et du caramel à fond avec une touche non abusive de bourbon. Une bière au corps bien balancé et agréablement pétillante. Arrière-goût délicat de butterscotch. Une bière dun style qui mest peu familier et pourtant très agréable à boire.

660ml bottle. Pours a clear copper with a very thin beige head. On the nose, the bourbon barrel is in the forefront, with butterscotch, buttery oak, and almost red licorice notes. Taste wise, WHOAH! Butterscotch, butterscotch, butterscotch with raisin, buttery oak, alcohol burn, and seriously, more butterscotch that heads into almond, buttery oak, vanilla, and a finish that has SOME bourbon, but a TONNE of Jameson Irish Whiskey-like notes. I love this. Pure gold.

Où, Quand, Comment : 
Bouteille, dégustée le 8/20/2013. 


Visuel :  
Couleur : brune. 
Apparence : légèrement voilée. 


Arôme :  

Caramel, boisé (bourbon), léger de fruits (raisins, notes de pommes sucrées), notes de vanille. 


Goût :  
Entrée de bouche : Léger goût fruité (raisins, traces de pommes) avec un goût boisé (bourbon) et des notes de vanille. 
Une dominante maltée de caramel sucré avec des notes de toffee est présente avec un moyen goût dalcool réchauffant ainsi que des notes de butterscotch et de houblon herbeux.


En bouche :  

Corps : moyen.
Effervescence : moyenne.
Texture : légèrement crémeuse.
Finale : moyenne-longue, composée dune légère amertume dalcool avec un léger résiduel sucré ainsi que des notes boisées et de houblon herbeux.

Picked up a bottle while on vacation in Montreal. Agree with other folks here who say it's like dessert in a bottle. Pours dark amber, almost no head, light carbonation.  I thought it had a bit of a sharp, alcohol-y smell, but upon first sip this quickly mellows to tastes of vanilla, caramel, chocolate, coffee, bourbon. Very yummy.

660ml bottle. Rich mahogany in colour with a almost non exsistant head, very spotty lacing. The aroma is slightly alcoholic, vanilla, some coconut, woody. The flavour is warming, lots of bourbon, sweet, vanilla and woody notes. Warming mouthfeel, thin body, mild carbonation. Finishes long, warming and sweet. Its not bad but it does seem a bit thin. Quite warm and sweet at times.
Poured From a 660 ml bottle it is a light amber with no head. The aroma is is bourbon and the taste is a flavors of bourbon and vanilla Yummy
From a 660 ml bottle shared at home. Pours a clear deep mahogany with an ecru head. Vanilla nose. Flavors of bourbon, oak and vanilla. Smooth, rich finish. Yum

650 ml bottle. Clear dark brown-red with thin head. Nose is barrel, vanilla, bourbon, brown sugar, earthy moss. Taste is the same, mildly warming. Very well balanced I get just enough barrel and scotch ale maltiness. This is a satisfying sticky sipper that goes down too easily.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 Robe brune tirant vers le rougeâtre, léger col de mousse blanc qui disparaît tranquillement. Dentelle epaisse qui laisse la mousse se coller aux parois du verre. Arômes de bourbon, vanille, caramel salé, bois, toffee, alcool, canne à sucre. Un équilibre et une complexité à revendre. Cest doux, soyeux et la haute teneur en alcool ne semble pas vouloir se mettre à lavant-plan. En bouche, encore là cest superbe. Beaucoup de bourbon et vanille. Le caramel et toffee perçus au nez reviennent également en force. Lalcool se manifeste également mais sagence bien avec les saveurs. Pointes de bois, un peu de malt rôti, cassonade, baies foncées, un peu de houblons amers. Texture sirupeuse, corps riche et assez lourd mais qui se laisse boire. Une carbonatation faible mais à point. Degustée à température cellier, elle est incroyable. Un classique que je navais pas revisité depuis longtemps. Une autre de ses qualités est quelle est disponible pratiquement en tout temps.

A big rich scotch ale. Nose features malt , brown sugar and a hint of dark fruit. This is a well balanced, big, rich double scotch ale. The taste profile has a number of well balanced elements - dark caramel malt, toffee, vanilla, bourbon booziness and hints of oak, grain, molasses and dark ripe fruit. Under it all, there is enough hops (barely) and soft carbonation to keep this all real. Nice rich body aswell.

This beer represent at 100% what a Quebec beer is suppose to be. Its light brown color with its caramel and distant banana smell makes it delightful. The taste of this beauty is beautifully balanced between caramel and the Bourbon of course. Cheers and enjoy!

Loin dêtre un amateur de bourbon, celle-ci ma bien plus toutefois. Le bourbon, lalcool, la vanille et le bois prennent presque toute la place, mise à part une belle touche de malt assez riche. Avec les fromages que nous avions, cétait cochon!

Drank this last night with the boys at the cottage, so memory is a little hazy to say the least. That being said, with every sip I kept thinking, "goddamn this stuff is good". I remember lots of sweet toffee and caramel, which combined with the oak barrels to give this delicious, quasi-maple syrup effect. Lots of nice bourbon/vanilla notes, and very much "rich in chewy malt character". Soooooo bloody smooth for an 11% beer. Remarkably drinkable for such a big, burly beer. Och aye indeed.
Bomber in trade from Pushkinwow...thanks. Dark caramel pour. Strong scotch with vanilla aroma. Taste follows, decent finish. Not my favorite style but decent beer.

Bottle shared by Tom, thanks! Pours a clear amber orange with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has sweet grains, light bourbon and a hint of toffee. Flavor has lots of sweet grains with a growing caramel and toffee note supported by bourbon.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, thanks Tom! Hazy dark brownish pour with off white head, aroma brought big sweet vanilla, coconut, bourbon notes into some caramel, toffee and molasses notes, some oaky, spicy, and almost charred notes come through with more sweet fruity notes. Taste was a mix of sweet caramel, vanilla, toffee and fruits into some bourbon, oak, and slightly earthy notes with a hint of spice, finishing fairly sweet.
Bomber shared by Tom - thanks! Murky orange amber pour. Big vanilla and oak blast on the aroma. Dry oaky finish. Very nice.

Au nez, c'est vanillé, sucré, tannique. En bouche, c'est fort, liquoreux, râpeux. La finale est quand même sèche, alcoolisée et bourbonée! Pas vilain

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Marshmallow bourbon caramel aroma. Taste is delicious; sweet caramel, vanilla, bourbon, with a long sticky finish. Very nice.
Pours light brown with light head and some lacing. Nose is big vanilla and lots of sweet syrup and cheerios. Medium bitter and med/big sweet. Medium body with lively carbonation. Nice big beer.
Wow. The burban flavors are really coming through in this one. If you were ever looking for a beer whisky hybrid it has arrived. Not for the faint of heart.

Brun opaque aux reflets sucre dorge. Faible col. Nez de banane et noix,sucre dorge, caramel et érable, pruneaux, cannelle et muscade. Vanille, bourbon, une touche fumée, une pointe de Jerez, décorce dorange et de canneberges...cest superbement complexe. Ronde, une touche sucrée mais bien équilibrée, rétro de pruneaux... ça doit être génial avec un lapin aux lardons. pas trop de lourdeur, lallonge est infinie. Une bière du Castor à boire en décembre... rien de mieux!

Pours a hazy copper color with not much of a head. Aroma of caramel, vanilla, wood and some green notes. The taste is toffee, caramel, big wood notes, booze, vanilla, Nilla wafers. Medium bodied, fairly hot.

Aroma: caramel, bourbon, syrup, oak. App: Brown/redish blurred, good carbonation. Taste is pretty good. Bourbon, vanilla, fruits... So good. Palate: not as thick as you would expect from a scotch ale due to oak aged. Overall: great beer, great balance but you can definitely taste the high abv but personally don?t mind.
Reddish brown beer with no real head, but tons of carbonation. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla. Sweet caramel, lots of bourbon barrel, vanilla. Good stuff

Bouteille de 660ml payée 11,95$ chez Saucisserie BDF. Arôme de bourbon, bois de chêne, sucre, vanille. Couleur brun très foncé avec reflet rougeâtre, autour de 30+ de SRM avec relativement opaque. Un délice au goût, vanille, caramel, avec un petit soupçon de scotch, équilibre parfait. Palais idéal aussi, rondeur superbe, lourd en bouche, effervescence très faible, très peu damertume. Une très bonne bière a mettre dans son cellier.

Bottle from my hipster neighbour -- thanks man! -- pours a bubbly bog water brown with a paper thin cap. Nose is pure bourbon, Jim Beam family (which includes Knob Creek among others). First sip reveals an odd truth: this tastes pretty close to a weak bourbon & coke. No really, it does. Sure, theres a slight bitterness in the finish but that pure organic sugar cane leaves it mark on the flavour profile. Its a interesting brew -- & at 11% a serious buzz enhancer -- but I think Id just have my bourbon straight up with a couple of cubes. Mrs Tiki steals a sip & damn if that little beer hater dont like this. This brew is one of a kind.

Clear orange/brown with a small brownish topping. Toffee and caramel with bourbon stint. Some smoked malt note. Mainly sweet taste, with a bitterness kick in the aftertaste. Nice round, thick mouthfeel, long sweet and warm finish

de couleur ambre brun foncé on sens tout suite le bourbon qui est tres present et on na un coté carameliser en bouche c est tres costaud en bouche on na un cote de bourbon qui est tres present suivie d un cote carameliser on na un cote pas trop sucre a cause du cote du bourbon biere a siroter tranquilement exemple devant un feu

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2017 Bottle. It is a deep reddish amber. The aroma is sweet caramel and malty bourbon. Med-full bodied with a round zesty feeling. The taste is light bourbon, oak, vanilla, caramel. 2017 The 2nd Time Around. A mahogany brown color with minimal head. The aroma is sweet malts and oaky bourbon. Smooth bodied with a dry finish. The taste is oaky with light bourbon flavor and sweet malts. Good stuff but not pushing any boundaries.
A sipper to be shared. Very rich in flavour, smoke and bourbon both there and integrated. A good woodiness. Satisfying.
Rouge ambré, odeur de scotch, peu damertume et un fort caramel, bourbon, chaud et rond, délicieux.

Apparence: D?une couleur ambrée foncée translucide, elle est coiffée d?une légère mousse d?une couleur caramel d?une courte durée. Effervescence difficile à évaluer, mais semble quasi inexistante.

Arômes: Au nez, ce sont des notes de malt caramélisé. 

Saveurs: En bouche, cest un corps ample. Au goût, cest des saveurs dalcool (Bourbon) et de malt caramélisé. De bonne durée, il ny a aucune effervescence, ni amertume. 


Fiche technique 
Style: Scotch Ale (Wee Heavy)
Format: 660 ml
Taux d?alcool : 11%

Pours an opaque dark brown. Both head and lacing are minimal.
Aromas are of Chinese food soy sauce and booze.
Tastes are very boozy, with some molasses, and maybes bit of raisin on the swallow.

660ml bottle. snifter. pours light brown with very little to no head at all. after a quick swirl, lots of wood aromas and bourbon. taste starts off loaded with toffee and caramel, but towards the end just before the alcohol kicks in, theres a distinct vanilla flavour. i like it a lot. full bodied, thick and chewy. this a a big beer to sip on with a book in hand. cheers!
Quelle bière! Un heureux mélange de houblon et scotch. Le scotch rend le goût de la bière très douce et laisse un arrière-goût de scotch.
Poured in low light, short lived head, great Bourbon aroma, better taste, vanilla and butterscotch, actually tastes like a higher ABV than 11. More please.

Poured from a bottle. Medium caramel color, small off white head. Strong bourbon nose. Full body with a rich bourbon flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of bourbon, whiskey coloured with an off white short lasting head. Tastes like a smooth well aged bourbon. Creamy feel with a slightly sweet grainy palate.
Orange pour with watery white head and lace. Aroma is vanilla, oak, and bourbon barrell. Flavor is BB, oak, vanilla, followed by a nice abv warmth. Medium bodied and fizzy.

Taste during RBSG, from a 22oz bottle. Orange amber color. Thin khaki head. Fine particles visible in the body. Decent bits of lace. Nice caramel, vanilla, butter scotch in the nose. Hint of smoke, light spice. Bigger body. Smooth, soft, kind of creamy lighter carbonation. Moderate to bigger sweet taste. Light bitter, more dry finish. Tasty BA scotch ale.

So I guess I have VerticalBaconStrips to thank for this one? Pretty cool, as hes one tame fellow & its a beer I had wanted to try, but it appears Im a touch against the grain on my reception of it. 
The beer pours a hazy red with a decent head and some lacing on the glass.

The aroma is very boozy, its got some light cherry and bourbony vanilla notes. The malt character is there, but its just buried by alcohol and barrel notes. 

The flavor is boozy and malty. Its nutty and sweet with some light tobacco... but again it tastes very strongly of alcohol... far moreso than of the other identifiable bourbon traits therein.
Bottle from vertbaconstrips I brought to RBSG St. Louis. Pours amber with tan head. Nose/taste of bourbon, oak, vanilla, caramel and lightly sweet molasses. Medium body.
750ml corked and caged bottle. Brown pour, decent head. Bit of oxidaiton up front, very nice caramel and dark fruit flavors. Not bad.

This is a very slightly cloudy amber brown with a small head. It smells mildly of bourbon and is sweet and sticky w/ some cherry and vanilla character. It is a medium bodied brew w/ mild carbonation and earthy bitterness. It finishes w/ a good bit of an alcoholic burn which makes it come off as medicinal. This is kind of too big for its own good.
Sampled at RBSG. Hazy amber with just a little off white foam. A bigger bourbon aroma. Rich malts. A bold flavor is huge malts, bourbon, wood, and something floral. Really good stuff.

Bière très riche et complexe! Se déguste comme un bon scotch. Une bonne bière pour finir la soirée, un dessert! Très bon! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une robe rubis avec une dentelle qui saccroche au verre. Dabord un arôme subtile et une première gorgé où le bourbon se démarque. Mais le goût évolu avec le temps et on découvre le scotch ale de plus en plus. À un certain moment, ca me fait même penser au Pina Colada, lorsquil est fait avec du rhum brun vieilli. Bonne texture et belle complexité. Jadore.

Bottle, 04/28/2014. Pours deep mahogany, ruby highlights, medium light tan head, decent retention and lacing. Aroma is rich, fruity caramel malt, lightly toasted brown sugar, vanilla coconut, full bourbon finish. Taste is fruity, mild banana-like notes, caramel and chewy bourbon notes, heavy wood, vanilla. Medium heavy body, round and full on the palate, bourbon quite strong but works well here. Quite nice, great BA Scotch Ale.

Bomber from Broue Ha Ha. Light mahogany with a light tan head. First sniff of this made me feel disappointed as it was very sweet and unbalanced - lots of brown sugar, toffee, vanilla, stale caramel, some booze, a bit of marshmallow, grainy. Mild carbonation and boozy sweet body, becomes somewhat dry and fruity. I just dont think the fruit and barrel treatment combined with the malt profile work for me...to each their own though.

Sweet, vanilla, huge bourbon in the aroma and taste. Smoke, brown sugar, molasses coming through as it warms. Thicker mouthfeel. Heavier than youll ever be and youll be on your ass if you dont share this with minimum 2 friends
Bottle; brown, cloudy, with small brown foam; aroma-very sweet, vanilla, woody, leather, maple syrup; heavy sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, sticky, soft carbonation. Very good

Brune trouble, presque opaque, aux reflets orangés. Nez sucré, de cuir et dalcool. Goût sucré, de whisky et de fruits. Elle est puissante et se laisse savourer tranquillement, très tranquillement... cest quand même 11 % dalcool.
Style Scotch Ale, sucré sans amertume. Prendre fraîche, pas trop chaude pour ne pas gâché le gout caramel, toffee

Nearly opaque muddy brown pour with a fairly minimal tan head that leaves just a lace of head after 22 seconds. On the nose we have a melange of vanilla and peat smoke and bourbon and brown sugar and wooden barrel. Great on the palate as well. The alcohol is present but quite light for the 11%ABV this stuff touts. All the elements from the nose come out to play again. Theres a light sweetness in the warm finish. Im a fan.

[5228-20130413] 660mL bottle. Bourbon-soaked planks of wood aroma. Clear, amber brown body with quick foamy white head. Oaky wood toasted grains flavour. Medium-full body. Interesting to try. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4
Overheard: "I have a giant colourful box. Im like a unicorn, thats where rainbows come from."

660ml bottle. Murky light brown with a thin foamy off-white head. Flavors are bourbon, vanilla, caramel and banana with fruity and oaky notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture. Nice sipper but a bit cloying.

66 ml bottle bought in a organic store in Sainte-Anne-de-Bellevue (Quebec) over a year ago. Caramel brown hazy, thin head. Aroma of bourbon and sweet barley, slightly spicy with a little alcohol. The taste is much the same thing, but more bitter and the alcohol is more present. This is a beautiful marriage of bourbon and barley!

Couleur ambrée brune très opaque avec aucun col. Nez très intense et complexes de caramel,biscuit,épices. En bouche cest une explosion de saveur, jai jamais goutté une scotch ale autant savoureuse: Caramel,Biscuit,bois,bourbon,alcool,épices,sucre avec une petite touche de chocolat. Jen oubli peut-etre. 
Selon moi cette bières est un plus grand joyaux que la yakima IPA de cette même micro. Un instant a déguster!

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 Pours a dark brown with a thin white head that leaves great lacing. Nose is of raisins and booze, slight green apples. Taste is sweet and alcoholic, oxidated. Cardboard. Some bourbon and buttery caramel edges. Alcohol burns. Body is a bit weak to me, I wish it were fuller (it is medium). Carbonation a bit intense and fizzy but it quiets down after a while. Mind is not blown. (3.6)

Update, 2014-01-21: I recapped this bottle and sampled some today. Of course this is coming from the fridge door but it feels better integrated than when we first opened it. Nose is more bourbon forward and less "hot" (harsh) and everything strangely a little more enjoyable. Bumping this one to 3.7 from 3.6.

660ml bottle, hazy brown color, with a small beige head, with a mild yeasty, fruity, dried raisin, date, fig nose, with some mild grated coconut, vanilla, mild bourbon wood barrel, toffee, light brown chocolate notes, with a light biscuity, caramelized, toasted malty accent in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth yeasty, fruity, bourbonish oak barrel, grated coconut, raisin pie character, with some caramel, toasted, biscuity malty, toffee, barley sugar, sugar pie, dired dark fruit flavours, leading towards a warming bourbonish, vanilla, coconut, brown chocolate, dark dried fruit, lingering mild alcoholic booziness finish.

Un des remèdes parfaits pour les soirées glaciales de nos hivers québécois, cette bière de couleur brune légèrement rougeâtre dégage un col très mince qui ne fait que passer dans le verre. Lalcool (bourbon) et un aspect sucré qui rappelle la cassonade se démarquent au nez, impressions gustatives qui se répètent au goût. Des traces de fruits confits simmiscent également dans la richesse maltée de la bière, procurant ainsi une rondeur fort agréable en bouche. Un incontournable dans le style au Québec.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2015 Bière brune aux reflets rouge-orangés, bien voilée, bonne effervescence, et surmontée dun mince col brunâtre qui se réduit assez rapidement à une simple trace à la surface du liquide. Arômes bien maltés de pain grillé, pâtisserie, noisette, abondant caramel, et beaucoup de fruits foncés confits, particulièrement de la datte. En fait, cette bière sent le gâteau aux dattes et cest très agréable! On note également les effluves dun agréable alcool (bourbon!), ainsi quun léger boisé, un peu de fumée, de terre et de tourbe, et, enfin, quelques subtiles épices (clou de girofle, muscade, piment de la Jamaïque, anis). Nez très agréable, affichant une très bonne intensité et une belle complexité. En bouche, pétillement plutôt faible sur la langue, mais la bière est lourde et présente un corps dune rondeur exceptionnelle, cest très onctueux, moelleux et velouté au palais. Au goût, entrée maltée de pain grillé, pâtisserie, caramel et datte, mais le malt est moins dominant quau nez. Ce sont plutôt les saveurs dalcool (bourbon) et de boisé qui prennent le dessus. Davantage en arrière-plan, on retrouve les chaudes épices et quelques subtiles saveurs de terre et de tourbe. La finale est longue et alcoolisée, mais elle présente tout de même une certaine amertume. Intensité incroyable en bouche, bonne complexité, très bon goût malgré un déséquilibre évident en faveur des saveurs liées au vieillissement en fût de bourbon. Excellente bière!

Deep amber tiny head not much lacing. Floral bourbon with caramel. Spicy with toffee notes. Taste floral bourbon with spicity alcohol. Spicy with caramel. Finish spicy with floral notes. Quite floral with light vanilla notes. Nice stuff but nothing very special. A bit too much alcohol.

Arôme de malt agé et de sucre foncé/mélasse. On sent déjà que ce sera une bière forte en alcool... Au goût cest effectivement assez intense, on a limpression quil y a une part dalcool fort (40%) dans la recette. Cest une bière occasionelle, de dégustation. Je peux apprécier le style, une fois de temps en temps, mais cest loin dêtre mon préféré.

Bottle. Clear red pour with white head. Aroma is quite bourbony, lots of red fruits, vanilla, oak, rich molasses maltiness. Rich malty flavor, sweet, caramelized sugars, soothing, warming alcohol. Smooth rich palate. Blind, I thought this was an american barleywine, a nice big sipper.

Bottle with thanks to Gikinji! Pours clear reddish amber with a small tan head and some lacing. Aroma is initially bourbon and seven, with notes of caramel and molasses. The seven up fades as the beer breathes. Flavor is the same, medium sweet, toffee, dried fruits. Some woody astringence, which also fades as the beer breathes. Medium body. Lacking some complexity.

(from backlog of RBAG 2013 ratings notes). I dont really need the notes from RBAG, as I received my own bottle in trade from Gikiniji (thanksSeb!) AND I wasable to grab a couple more while in Quebec last month. Low-carbonation red-brown pour. Very sweet aroma bordering on candy-ish. Fruity caramel flavour, some red licorice, some butter-rum, all coming together as a very sweet composition. Warm alcoholic finish. A bit too sweet for my preference, but still very cool.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pours a dirty, dull brown-amber color with a remarkably short, tan head. Smoothly blended aromas of caramel and ripe red fruit. Mouthfeel is slick and wet with a very slight carbonation burn toward the finish. Surprisingly mild flavors that have difficulty masking the alcohol. Sweet caramel up front with some oak flavor emerging, and finishing with a mildly tart fruitiness.
Une de mes bières préférées. Les saveurs de bourbon sont savamment dosées Avec un arrière goût tes agréable. Elle fait partie des grandes Scotch Ale selon moi et mérite à être connue.

Woah! This beer totally blew my mind! I was expecting disappointment after pretty much falling in love with their Yakima I.P.A. after having much difficulty faulting it. Beautiful amber color, very sweet and rich texture almost offsetting the high alcohol. Impossible to ignore the cask aging, I get that mouth numbness that only scotch/whiskey seems to trigger (even if I drink with moderation) and all of the taste/aroma that those kinds of beverages contain, complemented with a malty/caramel sweetness balancing out any harshness that may arise from such a high alcohol content for a beer. 

This is about as unique as it gets, Im looking forward to serving this with desert in a function with fellow craft beer enthusiasts. DEFINITELY not a session beer, to be enjoyed slowly preferably with a desert. Very complex for a beer with such a high alcohol content. Almost desert on its own...

Thanks to Eric at Churchkey and Bruce! Poured flat, clear ruby colored. Aroma is woody bourbon, booze, sweetness in the malts. Flavor is barrel, bourbon, sweet vanilla notes. Woah. So smooth. Alcohol masked.

Bottle from slovak thanks man! shared at RBAG 2013. pours dark brown with minimal head. Tons of booze and oak on the nose, this is a strong one. The taste is big and rich, lots of wood and heavy bourbon notes that makes for a very intense beer. The flavour is too cloying for me to find enjoyable for sure a bottle that is meant to be shared. 
.

650mL bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany), pours a murky dark amber brown with a small beige head. Aroma of somewhat smoky caramel malts, bourbon barrels, and wood. Flavour is very heavy and woody, full of smoked woody malts, bourbon barrels, loads of caramel, and some vanilla. Quite barrel-dominating, without being too overburdening. The sweetness is high, which cloys a bit after a while. Good stuff, but a little too sweet for me.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2013 Rousse/brune. Nez: Cerise noire. Noix Ã  fond. Anis. Malt. Biscuit. FruitÃ©. Citron. Bouche: Liquoreuse. TrÃ¨s sucrÃ©. Caramel. Toffee. MaltÃ© Ã  souhait. Caramel au beurre salÃ©. Colle aux dents. BoisÃ©. ChÃªne. Bourbon. Banane. Vanille. CarrÃ© aux dattes. Bonne biÃ¨re dessert.
Richmond 20th.  Medium to dark brown.  Aroma is caramel malt, slight pepper.  Flavor is rich caramel with a peppery finish.  Rather liked this.

Bomber shared by Kinz at the 20th Richmond Gathering. Pours a hazy copper color with not much of a head. Aroma of caramel, vanilla, wood and some green notes. The taste is toffee, caramel, big wood notes, booze, vanilla, Nilla wafers. Medium bodied, fairly hot.
From the bottle poured a light brown brew with a nearly no head. Aromas amd flavors of vanilla,coconut  and pepper with a nice easy hop finish.
Bottle @ RG 20. Chestnut with no real head. Smells like bourbon and chocolate. Lightly sweet balanced by a dryness. I think this is the first of this type that Ive actually liked.

[bottle]
Potent oaky bourbon aroma that dominates what might be a sweet, brown sugar/toffee malt. Hazy deep chestnut appearance under a tawny, beige ring and island. Sweet and smooth bourbon flavour that totally dominates the rich malt that I can tell is hiding. Still a very enjoyable drink, if off-balance towards bourbon and oak. Full body, moderate carbonation, clean finish.

Single bomber from Marché Omni (also available from my local Métro). Pours a clean copper colour with a beige soapy head that disappears rather quickly with minimal lace. At first pour, you can smell the typical bourbon scent (cherry, banana) and the wood from the barrels. After a while, dark fruits come out (raisins, dates, plums) with some light burnt caramel and alcohol. Smooth and silky mouthfeel with a medium-to-full body. Banana aftertaste from the Amercian whiskey. Notes of butterscotch, dark fruits, molasses and apples. Thankfully, you can feel the bourbon in this one, but not too much to be overkill. Well-balanced overall and worth trying if you like bourbon... and a wee heavy.

Arômes puissants de sucre cuit, dalcool fort et de boisé. Peu pétillante, elle a une belle couleur caramel, et semble mi-épaisse. Le bourbon est très présent, mais agréablement, et laisse la place aux sucres et autres saveurs présentes pour rendre ainsi la bière délicieusement complexe. On y dénote aussi des fruits (abricots, poires) qui viennent sajouter au décor. Pas pour toutes les bouches, cette bière nen est pas moins savoureuse, audacieuse et très réussie.

2013-04-13. Crisp dark brown body with a tiny brown head that fades. 3+ Big bourbony aroma, vanilla, light wood, sweet malt. Similarly big flavour of bourbon, vanilla, muted malt, modest malt lingers into the finish. 6+ Average plus bodied palate. Very bourbon dominant. Bottle shared by DuctTape

Bouteille 660ml. Premier brassin. Couleur acajou foncé, mousse couleur caramel pâle, un peu huileuse. Arôme de bourbon, vanille, boisé, caramel. Goût de bourbon en quantité, boisé, caramel, fumée légèr en arrière-goût, lalcool est si bien camouflé quil en est presque invisisble. Carbonation faible, corps moyen-dense.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Hazy, dark caramel-colored ale with ruby highlights and a small, creamy, off-white head. The aroma offers bourbon, vanilla, toasted coconut and caramel. Full-bodied with a velvety mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. The flavor is a sweet, lush mélange of vanilla, coconut and caramel. A tad too sweet, but still a world class beer provided by the ever-generous MartinT!

Bière trouble, couleur de noyer et où flotte un éphémère col crème laissant au verre une légère dentelle.  Des arômes caramélisés de cerises confites et de kirsch.  Moyennement amère et très sucrée avec une légère pointe aigre.  Elle est très effervescente, de corps baraqué et se termine raisonnablement, sur des arômes sucrés.

Clear meidum to dark brown pour covered by a slowly diminishing off-white foam. Sugary and bourbony nose, but Im drinking this bottle in March 2013, on the same day than I have bought the bottle directly from the brewery, being told that its the 4th batch and having had a bottle of the first batch back in October or November 2012, this one is definitely less bourbon-forward and rather focuses and maltiness and has an extra fruity kick. Indeed, cherry and banana purees meet the date-like caramelly sugars, borderline molasses, in a chewy, relatively thick context where sparse bubbliness accentuates the sweetness and digestive character. Banane flambée, plum pudding, milk chocolate and potent vanilla, there is a fair dose of complexity in here, but obviously, its one beer you really need to be in the mood for. While its bourbony alcohol level remains at reasonable level especially considering its 11% concentration, its very strong flavours and sweetness leave you no choice but to approach it as a sipper - one that is complex enough to be interesting, but one that really focuses on fruity caramelization. Not  particularly my type of beer, but still not very common in Quebec to encounter well executed examples of those very heady, complex bruisers and certainly very nice to add them in our provinces portfolio.

Bottle: Poured a deep amber color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of bourbon is dominant with some woody notes as well as some residual sugar notes are also perceptible. Taste is also dominated by a huge amount of bourbon with some residual sugar and toffee notes. Vanilla notes and woody notes are also perceptible though somewhat more subtle. Body is quite full with good carbonation and light warming alcohol notes can de detected. This is quite the extreme example of scotch ale with bourbon being really dominant. I enjoyed this but wouldnt want to drink too much on one session.

Dune puissance à toute épreuve, cette bière fait définitivement partie des plus goûteuses que jai bu au cours de la dernière année. Du sucre, du bois et du whisky; le tout servi dans une danse rythmée par le chaos total et le silence parfait (je me comprends dans ma poésie). Un gros bonbon pour adultes avertis qui vit en harmonie avec ses paradoxes. À ce titre, la réserve Wee Heavy Bourbon du castor possède les défauts de ses qualités : son intensité à tout casser attirera les amateurs de sensations fortes et de démesure autant quelle fera fuir ceux qui recherchent la subtilité et léquilibre.

Bouteille de 650 ml partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Odeur de bourbon avec une pointe de boisé. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée légèrement voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de bourbon et de caramel avec une pointe de boisé. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de vanille en arrière goût. (Rating #4608)

Une bouteille de 660ml. Bière brune cuivrée ambrée foncée avec mousse beige. Le nez est de bourbon, pas Louis XIV, mais lalcool, le prix est de 12,89 pas des pengö mais des dollars du Dominion, la bouche est un peu dérable, pas les biscuits mais le sirop, lalcool est de 11 degrés pas proof mais dalcool par volume. La finale est sucrée, pas.

Brune opaque aux reflets acajou, coiffée dune mousse qui se résorbe lentement en omettant de barbouiller les parois. Le bourbon courtise le nez dès quon le lui présente. Au travers cette masse alcoolisée, le caramel, la vanille et des pointes boisées se regroupent. Au goût, ça semble mieux équilibré. Le whiskey du fût se gonfle moins le torse, au contraire, il accompagne ses acolytes gustatifs, tel que le caramel et le bois sec. Le pourcentage dalcool se fait bien sentir. La bouche est bien garnie, bien occupée par le liquide, qui nous laisse un arrière-goût tout en sucre résiduel. (491-211212)

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2012 Dark copper amber with a medium thin beige head, fading. Intense bourbon aromas of coconut and vanilla. Some dark fruits shows up after a while with raisins showcasing. Full body, syrupy, very malty, boozy, all malts in there, with a strong vanilla flavor developing troughout the palate. Finishing on a burning alcoholic note. For big malt lover, and bourbon flavored beer only, wich is understandable for the style, but this bottle is very hard to drink by itself. Speaking of drinkability here would be non-sense. Its even hard to sip on this one without feeling like eating a whole bag of  raw cassonade. 4 oz. would have been sufficient...nonetheless well made .

750 ml bottle shared with Alex and Seb bought at flaveurs dici A: vanilla, caramel, butterscotch good  presence from the bourbon. App: murky brown close to no head.  T/p: full body sweet and long finish. Sticky texture. O: great offering the wood is truly present make it a nice winter warmer.

Aroma: Strong bourbon accents with molasses, anise, and oakwood. Beautiful complex and powerful nose.
Appearance: Murky brown with little creamy head, leaving a thick film on glass but with a very little lacing.
Taste: Caramel and toffee explosion, with notes of butter and oak as finish. Very sweet and delicious. Fabulous for pairing dessert. Finish is with oak and wood accents. Bourbon is wrapping everything very nicely. Body is full, texture syrupy. Flavors are sweet and powerful; its like chewing a piece of toffee dipped in bourbon.

Bouteille 11%. Couleur brune voilée, mousse beige mince. Arôme pleine de bois et de bourbon, un peu de malt, caramel. En bouche, du velour ET du caramel, malt, sucre et ensuite, le bois et le BOURBON...plein de bourbon..la finale est toute en bourbon et malt. Un grosse bière...amateur de bourbon attention...complexe, pas la plus équilibrée mais ce nest pas un défaut dans ce cas, cette bière sassume pleinement. Excellente.
Bouteille de 660ml, robe brune cuivrée, arôme de bourbon et de vanille, goût très vanillé donc très bourbon!

Bottle - 660ml. Cloudy dark brown body with average carbonation and a thin off-white foamy head. Rich, complex malty/hoppy aroma with bourbon, vanilla, fruity, and oaky hints. Alcohol is well hidden. Its wonderful malty/hoppy taste carries oaky, liquorous, and plummy notes. It ends with a long, warming bittersweet finish. Awesome!

Brown bottle, 660 ml, purchased at Broue Ha Ha, savoured on December 2 2012; eye: dark brown with a reddish hue, opaque, nice tan head that turns into a tiny ring, light lacing; nose: bourbon, woody, caramel, light hops, anise, light alcohol; mouth: bourbon, woody, caramel, anise, light alcohol, light alcohol warmth, finale in anise with presence of alcohol warmth, medium-full body, below-average carbonation, mildly sweet, lightly bitter, lightly harsh texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 660 ml, achetée chez Broue Ha Ha, savourée le 2 décembre 2012; il : brun foncé avec une teinte rougeâtre, opaque, belle mousse fauve qui se transforme en un petit anneau, légère dentelle; nez : bourbon, boisé, caramel, léger houblon, anis, léger alcool; bouche : bourbon, boisé, caramel, anis, léger alcool, léger chaleur dalcool, finale en anis avec présence de chaleur dalcool, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement amère, moyennement sucrée, texture légèrement rugueuse; en résumé : très bon

Bottle 660ml.
Pours dark brown with minimal head. Aroma is of bourbon, malt, sugar. Taste is of bourbon, malt, sweetness. Palate: medium-full body. Overall: Very good, but lots of bourbon. Not recommended for drinking alone.

Bouteille 660 ml. Arôme et goût de bourbon, de vanille, de caramel, dalcool et de malt. Alcool bien masqué. Excellent équilibre. Un peu mince en bouche. Très buvable pour le style. Excellent Scotch Ale, originale tout en étant conforme au style.

Bottle (660 ml). Shared by BeerGolem, thanks Christophe! Dark amber with a medium beige and and good lacing. Aroma of bourbon, caramel, vanilla and alcohol. Taste is about the same with a good malty presence. Mouthfeel is a bit thin for this kind of beer. Alcohol is well hidden considering abv. Good balance, but I think the base beer need a little more complexity to make this a great beer. A very good first take on this style for this new brewery.

Aroma:Vanilla,oak,caramel..
Appearance:Dark cooper-brown,light lacing white head...
Flavor:full of oak vanilla bourbon flavor,caramel.. The beer is good but the oak flavor is a litle bit to mutch,,,,

bonne odeur de bourbon qui peut effrayer au nez mais qui en bouche se prendre certainement avec audace .gout de scotch ale aqgreable .Vanille caramel un gout de malt bien balance une biere qui va tres bien viellir a surveiller

Une bouteille partagée lors dune dégustation.  Une robe qui se colle au style.  Aucune construction mousseuse.  Un nez fortement touché par le bourbon américain.  Il y a des effluves végétales et boisées.  Des parfums de noix de coco et de chaudes notes éthyliques.  Il y a du caramel lorsque le liquide devient plus tempéré.  Provient-il de la base maltée ou simplement du bourbon lui-même?  Sur les papilles, un liquide qui est encore bien fouetté par la soupe américaine.  Des éléments maltés qui sinstallent avec une certaine difficulté.  Des notes caramélisées et fruitées.  Encore une fois, ces flaveurs se rattachent-elles davantage au bourbon?  En bouche, une impression qui intéresse avec un corps encore résistant et une texture plutôt douce.  En finale, une concoction qui réchauffe la gorge et qui ne laisse que des goûts de fût et de bourbon.  Je suis loin dêtre un expert du scotch ale en fût.  Ceci dit, je connais mes goûts et je trouve que le bourbon est beaucoup trop présent dans cette bouteille.  À défaut dêtre un accompagnateur (je pense ici à Backwoods, Reyne Descosse ou même Equinoxe), le bourbon est ici envahisseur.  Bref, pour moi, une bière intéressante mais pas palpitante.  À reboire, jimagine.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2012 My Bottom Line:
Vanilla bourbon and a touch of banana candy explode from this Barrel-Aged Scotch Ale, but evolve in a superbly silky mouthfeel where subtle jujubes, caramel and licorice thrive.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the cloudy dark mahogany.
-The bourbon is too intense for me, especially in the nose, but there is more going on in the flavor profile which makes it all instantly become delicious.
-The mouthfeel is velvety throughout; a very professional rendition of the style.
-This is a beautiful sipper for bourbon lovers (Knob Creek?) and a simple treat. for those cool evenings with no fireplace.
-This brewery is already doing great things and they are only brewing their first batches. One to keep an eye on for sure!

Bottles.

The pour reveals a cloudy brown color with a thin light brown head. Nice aroma of bourbon, vanilla, caramel and baked raisins. Very good flavor of bourbon, vanilla, baked raisins and caramel, its complex and the sweetness is not overboard. The body is medium with a vinous texture and soft carbonation. Impressive.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2013 Le nez fait un peu peur, le bourbon semble vouloir jouer les dictateurs mais en bouche cest agréablement différent. La vanille et le sucre à la crème infuse et refuse de se débalancer du chêne imbibé de whiskey. Leffervescence est un allié, son corps est un refuge et lalcool en profite pour sendormir. Belle surprise, rien à envier aux Américains là-dessus.

bottle from and sharedwith VT. almost clear brown, red tint, with a decent light beige head, decent retention. loads of chocolate and burnt caramel, toffee, smoked malts - nice, smoky, bourbon - never overwhelming, light acidity. big grassy, lightly resinous hops - balances this beer. soft carbonation, medium body. kinda wowed me.

660 ml bottle shared with czar and friends. Slightly foggy reddish-orange brown with a short lasting beige head. Smell is bourbon, brown sugar, chocolate, coconut. Taste is caramel, smoke, wood, bourbon, brown sugar. Sharp herbal bitterness comes and nicely balances all the sweetness. Lingering sweet caramel and herbal notes. Medium body, sticky mouthfeel. A solid scotch ale/barrel aged strong beer.
